body: @noblehng The methods on Tx are mainly for symmetry with the other methods. Cancelation works for Tx, if you define it to trigger Rollback. The in-flight argument could be true for any persistent server operation that gains a cancellation method. However, if you define what you care about in a Tx, then it will get rolled back properly. Non-Tx statements that might time out would be long selects often. So if you misuse the database, yes, context won't help you.
